metadata.title: CVE-2019-9208 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In Wireshark 2.4.0 to 2.4.12 and 2.6.0 to 2.6.6, the TCAP dissector couldcrash. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/asn1/tcap/tcap.cnf by avoidingNULL pointer dereferences.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9208` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.8-1~ubuntu16.04.0
libwireshark11 - 2.6.8-1~ubuntu16.04.0
libwiretap8 - 2.6.8-1~ubuntu16.04.0
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.8-1~ubuntu16.04.0
libwsutil9 - 2.6.8-1~ubuntu16.04.0
tshark - 2.6.8-1~ubuntu16.04.0
wireshark - 2.6.8-1~ubuntu16.04.0
wireshark-common - 2.6.8-1~ubuntu16.04.0
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.8-1~ubuntu16.04.0
wireshark-qt - 2.6.8-1~ubuntu16.04.0
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.8-1~ubuntu16.04.0').
